goal.ch:
程式語言導論
Linux 導論
安裝與使用 Cygwin（Windows）及 Mac 的 Linux 終端機
Python 基礎與實作

outline.ch:
程式語言導論
Linux 導論
在 Cygwin（Windows）上的安裝
使用 Cygwin 和 Mac 的 Linux 終端機
使用 Linux 編輯器 vi
Python 導論
安裝 Anaconda
使用 Jupyter Notebook
使用 Jupyter Notebook 進行 Python 編碼

textbook.ch:
Here are some of the best open-source books for beginners to learn and practice Linux:

“The Linux Command Line“ by William E. Shotts, Jr.

This book provides a great introduction to the Linux command line. It covers everything from basic commands to more advanced topics, making it ideal for beginners.
“Linux Fundamentals“ by Paul Cobbaut

This book covers the basics of Linux, including installation, command line usage, file management, and system administration. It‘s a comprehensive guide for beginners.
“Introduction to Linux“ by Machtelt Garrels

This book is a beginner-friendly guide that introduces Linux from the ground up, focusing on basic skills and concepts.
“GNU/Linux Advanced Administration“ by Remo Suppi Boldrito, et al.

Although more advanced, this book provides a good follow-up for beginners who want to deepen their knowledge in Linux system administration.
“Linux From Scratch“ by Gerard Beekmans

This is more of a project-based book that teaches you how to build your own Linux system from scratch. It‘s a great hands-on way to learn.
“The Debian Administrator‘s Handbook“ by Raphaël Hertzog and Roland Mas

While it focuses on Debian, the knowledge is applicable to most Linux distributions. It’s good for beginners who want to get into Linux system administration.
“How Linux Works: What Every Superuser Should Know“ by Brian Ward

This book explains the inner workings of Linux, which is beneficial for beginners looking to understand how Linux functions under the hood.
All of these books are available for free online and provide a solid foundation for beginners looking to learn and practice Linux.

Here are some of the best open-source books for beginners to learn Python coding:

“Automate the Boring Stuff with Python“ by Al Sweigart

This book is perfect for beginners as it focuses on practical programming tasks. It covers a wide range of topics and helps you learn Python through real-world projects.
“Python Crash Course“ by Eric Matthes

This is a hands-on, project-based book that introduces Python basics and then dives into building practical projects like games and web applications.
“Think Python: How to Think Like a Computer Scientist“ by Allen B. Downey

This book is excellent for beginners who want to learn programming concepts alongside Python. It covers the basics and gradually introduces more complex topics.
“Invent Your Own Computer Games with Python“ by Al Sweigart

This book teaches Python by guiding you through the creation of simple games. It’s a fun and engaging way to learn Python for beginners.
“A Byte of Python“ by C. H. Swaroop

This book is specifically designed for beginners and provides a gentle introduction to Python programming. It covers all the basics with clear explanations and examples.
“Learn Python the Hard Way“ by Zed A. Shaw

Despite its name, this book is beginner-friendly and teaches Python through a series of exercises. It’s a good way to practice coding and build a strong foundation.
“Python for Everybody“ by Charles Severance

This book is designed to teach programming to beginners using Python. It covers the basics of programming and data structures, making it suitable for complete newcomers.
“Full Stack Python“

While more advanced in certain sections, this open-source book provides an overview of Python for web development. It’s a great resource for beginners interested in full-stack development.
All of these books are available for free online and provide comprehensive coverage of Python programming, making them ideal for beginners.

gradMethod.ch:
1. 平時成績(課堂表現)30％
2. 期中考30％
3. 期末考40％

2. Mid-term Exams 30％
3. Final Exams 40％
